ARBC 101.courseDesc: Introductory Arabic includes listening, speaking, reading and writing.

ARBC 201.courseDesc: This course includes listening, speaking, reading, and writing practice, with a focus on cultural competency and conversational skills. Builds on Arabic 103.

ARBC 202.courseDesc: This course includes listening, speaking, reading, and writing practice, with a focus on cultural competency and conversational skills. Builds on Arabic 201.

ARBC 310.courseDesc: Provides advanced practice in written and oral communication, including journalistic, professional and creative writing. Examines contemporary cultural contexts through media and news. Taught in Arabic.

ARBC 320.fullName: Introduction to Language for the Professions
ARBC 320.courseDesc: This course covers Introduction to Arabic communication skills in areas such as contemporary business, health, and law in a culturally sensitive fashion. The content of this course may change every term it is offered and is repeatable for credit. Taught in Arabic.
ARBC 320.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 8 times for 27 credits

ARBC 410.courseDesc: This course provides advanced grammar instruction and fosters translation and communication skills within a contemporary cultural context. The content of this course may change every term it is offered and is repeatable for credit. Taught in Arabic.
ARBC 410.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 8 times for 27 credits

ARBC 420.fullName: Advanced Studies in Language for the Professions
ARBC 420.courseDesc: This course provides advanced communication skills in areas such as contemporary business, health, and law in a culturally sensitive fashion. The content of this course may change every term it is offered and is repeatable for credit. Taught in Arabic.
ARBC 420.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 8 times for 27 credits

ARBC 450.fullName: Advanced Studies in Language, Media, and Society
ARBC 450.courseDesc: Advanced analysis of the role of language and media in society, including sociolinguistics, gender, media studies, and communication. Taught in Arabic.
ARBC 450.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 8 times for 27 credits

ARBC I199.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
ARBC I199.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
